title: Money
description: As Jan renovates the condo, Michael confronts his growing debt every way he can, which includes pressuring his employees for a loan. Pam and Jim spend a night out on Dwight's family beet farm, now a bed and breakfast.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Coat! [throws coat at Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael just rented The Devil Wears Prada. He has his NetFlix sent here to the office, and he watches them in pieces when things are slow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Steak! Where's my steeaaak?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He's a big Meryl Streep fan, so I shouldn't be surprised that he's identified with her character.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get me Armani.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A suit?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On the phone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Like the main company number? Because I'm gonna have to call information.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Where's Armani? He's on the phone. Too slow. You are not going to Paris. I'm so much better than you are. [breaks into laughter]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I owe you an apology.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You finished the movie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. It was awesome. Big surprise ending. Won't ruin it for you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Meryl Streep is the bad guy. Never see it coming. Anyways, if I was mean in any way to you, I am sorry. I just want what's best for you, Mo Chuisle.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mo Chuisle. He's watching Million Dollar Baby... He's gonna try to kill me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So this one goes with my eyes and this one goes with your eyes. People have said I have very pretty eyes.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I haven't heard the same about you. So let's just go with mine.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, they both go with the carpet I've ordered, and if you go with the brown leather on the sofas, then they go with that too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We already have a sofa. So why do--

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: A futon's not a sofa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It... folds up. You've only seen it flat.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I know what a futon is, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I-- Ok. How much is this going to cost?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It costs what it costs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No-- don't... that doesn't even mean anything.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We have gone through this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Money has been a little tight lately. But, at the end of my life, when I'm sitting on my yacht, am I gonna be thinking about how much money I have? No. I'm going to be thinking about how many friends I have, and my children, and my comedy albums. I mean, I have a yacht, so I obviously did pretty well money wise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's just that you say it's gonna cost what it costs-- [phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on the phone] Michael, it's Ryan for you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Conniving little runt. Put him through.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Put him through. Yes. Ryan, my man!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [on the phone] I sent you an email about the new Powerpoint.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, and thank you for sending that to me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I had IT install the updated Powerpoint on the computer so you can use it for the presentation. I really want people there using Powerpoint.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, yeah, I dunno. I dunno, I think those IT guys messed up.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hold on, I'll get them on the phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looking at nothing] Wait, oh, no, here it is, here it is. Found it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [talking on phone] Sure, I can hold.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [picks up phone]  Dunder Mifflin, Dwight Schrute. Please hold. [opens book, then picks up phone] Schrute Farms, guten tag. How can I help you? Yes, we have availability on those nights. How many in your party? Oh no, I'm sorry, no king beds. No queen either. Well, we make our own mattresses that don't conform to the traditional sizes. Closest would be twin. Thank you so much for calling. Call back again. Aufedersein!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: None of your business, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you run the bed and breakfest?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is not a B and B.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Agrotourism is a lot more than a bed and breakfest. It consists of tourists coming to a farm, showing them around, giving them a bed, giving them brekafest.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Does the Department of Health know about this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not telling you anything. [lookings into the camera] Permits are pending. [phone rings] Dwight Schrute, Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hello, I'm looking for a room.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, this is a mis-use of company phones.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It says here you cater to the eldery.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where did you read that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Trip Advsior.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Trip Advisor is the life blood of the Agrotourism industry. A couple of bad reviews there, you might as well close up shop. That's what took down the Stalk Inn. One of the cutest little asparagus farms you'll ever see.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How many in your party?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Two?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We offer tours of the fields, and of the barn. Uh, perhaps you'll be interested in, um, Mose's table making demonstration?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So, um, I forgot to tell you that I need the car tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! Um, actually, I need the car.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Why? Improv? Why don't you just pretend you have a car? Good practice, incase you ever do a scene where you need to pretend you have a car?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Use to have two cars, traded 'em in, now we're down to one. Good economic sense. Although the new car is a Porsche. For her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One cardigan, one sleeping cardigan and one sleep apnea mask.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What about my cherub figurine?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You took that with you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No I left it on my night table-- your night table, by the lamp.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You are incorrect. I was recently scrubbing my room of memories, and I didn't see it there.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My girlfriend and I broke up recently. And I must say, I am relieved. Gives me a chance to sow my wild oats. In the Schrute family, we have a tradition, where when the male has sex with another woman, he is rewarded with a bag of wild oats left on his door step by his parents. You can use these oats to make oatmeal, bread, whatever you want. I don't care, they're your oats.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The bar uses an applause meter. That is why it's so important that you all come and applaud only for my band. Scrantonicity 2. NOT Scrantonicity, which I am no longer a part of. Michael, can I count on you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can not, I have a thing tonight.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Dammit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That reminds me, uh, if the invitation still stands, Pam and I would love to have dinner tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh no, I have a thing tonight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Darn it!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shoot!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How about this weekend?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, can't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We only had tonight free, and we really wanted to spend it with you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dammit to hell. I-I-ugh, ok. All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where are you going out tonight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You wouldn't understand. It's a secret.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I wouldn't understand or a secret?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You wouldn't understand, Jim. It's a secret.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm sorry Mr. O'Brian, I didn't mean to interrupt your dinner. I just have a very exciting offer. My records indicate that you have expressed interest in losing some weight. Well, what if I told you that I have a pill that will make you 50 pounds lighter in 5 minutes? How does that sound? Amazing right? Well, it won't be that fast, but it will-[notices camera]- it will be that easy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can't believe this place is real. I mean, I've heard about his beet farm for years, but wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The Beets Motel.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The Beets Motel? That is, wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you. Eh. The Embassy Beets. Radishon!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How are you doing this?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know! [Mose starts running by the left side of the car]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my gosh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just love sales. I love it to death. It's as simple as that. And I don't get to do it enough as a manager, so I took this second job. I count it as a hobby. Some people have golf, or relaxing.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: What's going on here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, I just got off the phone, and I was gonna make another call.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: We're a legit operation with a license from the city I can show you. We pay minimum wage against commision--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, they're with me, so... this is Nick Figaro, manager to the stars!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We have three rooms, each with a different theme.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are the themes?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: American, Irrigation, and Night-Time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Irrigation.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll put you down for Irrigation. Well then, do you have any special needs or diertary restrictions?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. We will be requiring a bed time story.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not even Harry Potter?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. Jim, come on.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: But you promised.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mose, bags! Now!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here we are, the Irrigation Room! A very special room. So I'll come get you before the table-making demonstration. And as of this morning, we are completely wireless here in Schrute Farms. But as soon as I find out where Mose hid all the wires, we'll get that power back on. All righty.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Everybody in the conference room. In 5 minutes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: These meetings are useless.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: I just want to remind you to stick to the script. Improving the work. So, make the call, say the lines, make the sale. Got it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very inspirational. [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: We're offering a $50 bonus tonight to the guy with the most sales. Ok.

quotes.speaker: Coworker #1
quotes.text: Or a woman.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Or a trained seal. [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: You could make jokes when you've made a sale there rookie, ok? [laughter ends]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmmm, I'd say 1 in 6.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I thought you asked me what our chances were in being murdered here tonight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, I've just realized, this is Pam's and my first night away together. I use to play it over my head, and it was just a little bit different. Maybe a uh, nice hotel. Or a romantic dinner. Wine... uh but, wine that wasn't made out of beets. Didn't think Dwight would be involved at all. And uh, I always imagined less manure. I mean, some manure, just... less.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mose, what are you doing? No Mose! Put the-- Put the manure down! Put it down! Do not throw it! DO NOT THROW IT! Ow!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, is Mr. Hudson there?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [on the phone] Yes, who is this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm just calling because you responded positively to the--

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Why are you calling me here at home?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Spanish accent] Senor, are you happy with your--

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Michael, I know that's you. Why are you calling me here at home?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [speaking with a different voice] Have you-- Have you considered satellite television?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Michael, I know that's you. I know your voice. Why are you calling me here at home? [Michael hands up]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [on the phone] When I'm at home at night in my own house in my sweats drinking some red wine watching my mystery stories, the last thing in the whole God forsaken world I want to hear is the voice of Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well your son sounds like he's really motivated. I think it's crazy the coach won't play him frankly.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: [hangs up phone] My office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You bet.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Just dial the number on the sheet and stick to the script. Say those words exactly, got it? I don't know why we have to keep on having this conversation.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, I know sales, and I had that sale, I just needed a few more minutes--

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: A few more minutes is a waste of our time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is not a waste of our time.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: This is a trading game.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: You give a quick pitch. You make the sale. You move on. That's how Vikram does it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Vikram doesn't have my people skills.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Good for Vikram, because he out-sells you every night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I hope this conversation has helped.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [reading to Jim, Pam, and Mose] And Harry saw the white hand raise its wand, and felt Voldemort's surge of vicious anger. Saw the frail old man on the floor write in agony. "Harry?" It was over quickly as it had come. Harry stood shaking in the darkness, clutching the gate in the garden, his heart racing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What did you get tonight?

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Oh it looks like mixed masala, eggplant, and rice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that looks good.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Oh, and what about you? Peanut butter flavor again?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am going with the vanilla crisp this evening.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Enjoy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: I was a surgeon back home.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wonder what I would've been back home?

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Well this is your home.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, but it's competitive here. What's a dollar worth in your land? Medical school must cost like 40 bucks or a donkey or something.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Uhh, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would've been chief of surgery... Or a cowboy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim and Pam hear noise] Wait, you're going up there?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Coward.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Pam sees Mose in an outhouse] Oh my God. What century is this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, here's the thing about Die Hard 4. Die Hard one, the original, John McClane was just this normal guy. You know, he's just a normal New York City cop, who gets his feet cut, and gets beat up. But he's an everyday guy. In Die Hard 4, he is jumping a motorcycle into a helicopter. In air. You know? He's invincible. It just sort of lost what Die Hard was. It's not Terminator.

quotes.speaker: Coworker #2
quotes.text: Dude, you should review movies. [other co-workers agree]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I actually wrote a movie.

quotes.speaker: Coworker #3
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm writing one, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Coworker #3
quotes.text: What's it about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, sort of a spy, thriller...

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: What's so captivating? [everyone stops talking, go back to work] I like captivating things. And this must be really captivating because it's keeping you off the phones. I mean time is your money, that's how I know how captivating it is. Because how much time you spend talking.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Pam and Jim hear Dwight crying] Ugh, your turn.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Jim knocks on Dwight's door, crying stops] Come in. Did you have another nightmare?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, Jim. I thought you were Mose.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Does Mose have nightmares?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yes. Ever since the storm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is everything satisfactory with your stay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just thought that I heard crying, moaning, or something in here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh. Well I'll look into that in the morning. Thank you for bringing that to the attention of the staff.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good night, Dwight. [Jim leaves, Dwight continues crying]

quotes.speaker: Coworker #2
quotes.text: Yeah, so we're all gonna go out for a beer. Do you wanna come?

quotes.speaker: Coworker #3
quotes.text: We'd love for you to come, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks, no, I have work tomorrow morning.

quotes.speaker: Coworker #2
quotes.text: All right, next time dude.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, see you guys. [Sees Jan] Hey, how you doin'?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You drive, I had too much wine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. How's yoga?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I didn't go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wh-Why not?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I just didn't!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: How was improv?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good night Vikram.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Good night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, congrats on the bonus.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Thank you Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm gonna have it one of these nights.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Well if you concentrate and make your calls faster, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good night.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Good night.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael. Morning. Hey Dwight, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You okay?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am better than you have ever been or ever will be. [Ryan walks in]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey guys! What's happening? How's my favorite branch doin'?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, Michael, why dont you start us off?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um... that wasn't much of an introduction.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ladies and gentlemen, your boss, Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahh, still lame. Okay. All right. Thank you, Ryan, for that wonderful introduction. Okay, um, today we're gonna be talking... about...PowerPoint! PowerPoint! PowerPoint! PowerPoint!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes I forgot about Ryan's presentation. And yes, it would have been nice to do well with the first presentation he had given me. But you know what else would have been nice? Winning the lottery.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And the best way to start is to hit start. And up comes the toolbar, that's what she said. What we have to do here is go to Run, and then you look up to PowerPoint. And we are in. We are going to register. You hit register-- Updates are ready. I should update. Um, estimated time 12 minutes, so this should take 5 or 10 minutes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Is this the first time you ever opened PowerPoint?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You didn't prepare a presentation at all, did you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I had a really rough night, and my boss can back you up on that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm your boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My other boss, Mr. Figaro.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You have another job?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What I do between 5:30 pm and 1 am is no one's business but mine and my other business'.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you a cocktail waitress?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You can not have another job if it affects your work here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It won't.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It did, all ready.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, honestly, it was unlikely I was gonna figure this out anyways. [Kelly laughs]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You're so funny.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Why is Darryl here? He works in the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I invited him.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's not a party. Darryl, back downstairs, this isn't information you need.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: There's information here? Yeah, you're right, I don't need this.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Okay. [makes out with Darryl]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, get off.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Umm, see you later tonight.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I have plans later.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Okay, bye honey.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How long until you actually get this presentation ready?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don't you do the presentation, because you know how to do it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You know what I really want? Honestly Michael, is for you to know it, so you can communicate to the people here, to your clients, to whomever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Huh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's whoever, not whomever.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, it's whomever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, whomever is never actually right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, sometimes its right.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Michael is right. It's a made-up word used to trick students.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. Actually, whomever is the formal version of the word.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Obviously it's a real word, but I don't know when to use it correctly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not a native speaker.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I know what's right, but I'm not gonna say, because you're all jerks who didn't come see my band last night.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Do you really know which one is correct?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's 'whom' when it's the object of a sentence, and 'who' when it's the subject.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, that sounds right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well it sounds right, but is it?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How did Ryan use it? As an object?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: As an object.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Ryan used me an object.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Is he right about that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How did he use it again?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It was Ryan wanted Michael, the subject, to explain the computer system, the object.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: To whomever, meaning us, the indirect object. Which is the correct usage of the word.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No one, uh, asked you anything ever, so whomever's name is Toby, why don't you take a letter opener and stick it into your skull.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Wait! This doesn't matter. And I don't even care. Michael, you quit the other job, or you're fired here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've never done this before. I've never quit anything in my life.  So, you are filming history.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nick, I had a dream last night that I had two full time jobs.  One here at the Lipophedrazone diet pill company--

quotes.speaker: Mr. Figaro
quotes.text: Lipophedrine

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And the other I was a Regional Manager of a small paper supply company called Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Figaro
quotes.text: Never heard of it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In this dream I did both of these jobs beautifully, and I loved it, and everybody loved me.  But the truth is, I can't do this.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Figaro
quotes.text: Are you quitting?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Figaro
quotes.text: Come back anytime, don't forget to disinfect your headset.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was never in this for the money.  But it turns out that the money was an absolute necessity for me.  I tried to live the dream.  I tried to have a job, a girlfriend, another job, and I failed.  But the good thing about the American dream is that you can just go to sleep, and try it all again the next night.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's up?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Me.  All night.  Dreaming about Angela's smoking hot body.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're being gross.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Not from a male perspective.  You need to set me up with her, I know she told you that she's looking, and she's totally not responding to my moves.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What moves?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I have moon-walked past accounting like ten times.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't believe that's not working.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I don't know if I really see you two together.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Really?  Well, maybe you should look in the smart part of your brain.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: She's very religious.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, well I come from a line Wasps so long it leads back to Moses.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, well she takes her convictions pretty seriously, she can be kind of severe.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, and I punched a hole in a wall.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's right, you did.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Now that I think about it, Angela and Andy might actually make a good couple.  But I couldn't do that to Dwight... or Angela... or Andy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Kevin, you're a gambler right?  A rounder, you play the ponies, small horses.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I do gamble Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I was thinking about doing some gambling myself.  You know, just a little bit of money.  Maybe doubling it, and them doubling it seven more times.  I don't know, kind of just for fun.  I was thinking, do you have tips, or ideas about sure things.  Like a boxer who is going to throw the big fight, you know, like, like he's tied into some crooked dealings, maybe his kid is sick or something.  Like, who do I call about that?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The mob.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you know anybody in the mob?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [shakes head no]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, um, Oscar, I'm going to need to take another advance on my salary.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What do you mean you have plans tonight?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I have my daughter tonight; we're renting Charlotte's Web.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, you have to make a choice, it's either your daughter, or me.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: My daughter.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Okay, I see how it is. [pushes a stack of files onto the floor] Oops.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That was cold.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [makes a W then an L with her fingers, and then runs a finger across her throat]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: He's always been terrible with money.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I bet it's Jan spending him straight to the poor house.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, women be shoppin'.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I can't believe he has a second job.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He's not even good at his first one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Shh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What'cha talking about?  [camera pans to each face in the break room]  Okay, I know what's going on.  You're talking about Jim and Pam, if they're having sex, what it looks like, I know, I think--

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, are you having money problems?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Monkey problem? No, I'm not having monkey problems.  Why would I have monkey problems?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You heard me correctly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I hate monkeys.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's going on, why do you have a second job?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't have a second job.  Maybe I'm having an affair with Suzanne Summers.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Doesn't Jan have money?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't talk to my girlfriend about money.  It is rude, and unsexual.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: True, it's best to hide our money problems from women.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I totally agree with you.  But I don't have money problems, I don't.  Alright, you know what?  Watch this, if I had money problems, would I do this? [Michael holds up a bill, crumples it up, puts it back in his pocket]

quotes.speaker: {oscar} and {stanley}
quotes.text: You just put it back in your pocket.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, but I destroyed it, it's not even useable anymore.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, let's call this what it is.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's like she only wants to hook up when Ryan comes around.  It's gotten to the point where I get excited every time I see that little dude walk through the door.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, I just need to know where this is going.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, I like you.  Oh yeah, what's not to like?  But you need to access your uncrazy side, otherwise maybe this thing's run its course.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Don't you dare walk away from me Darryl Philben, you are the most selfish person I've ever met in my entire--

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Slow down, think it over.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Darryl Philben is the most complicated man that I've ever met.  I mean, who says exactly what they're thinking?  What kind of game is that?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey cuz, heard you're having money problems.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No you didn't.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Listen, I've got the answer.  You declare bankruptcy, all your problems go away.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Creed Bratton has never declared bankruptcy.  When Creed Bratton gets in trouble, he transfers his debt to William Charles Schneider.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How would that help Creed?  In Monopoly when you go bankrupt, you lose.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You don't go by Monopoly man, that game is nuts.  Nobody just picks up "get out of jail free" cards, those things cost thousands.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is a good point.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Bankruptcy, Michael, is nature's do-over.  It's a fresh start, it's a clean slate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like the witness protection program.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Not at all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've always wanted to be in the witness protection program.  Fresh start, no debts, no baggage.  I've already got my name picked out, Lord Rupert Everton.  I'm a shipping merchant who raises fancy dogs.  That's the life.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I... DECLARE... BANKRUPTCY!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, I just wanted you to know that you can't just say the word bankruptcy and expect anything to happen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't say it, I declared it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Still, that's not anything.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This is a lot of credit card debt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, tell me about it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, Jan has my credit cards, and she's using them as if I'm made of money, she thinks I'm a human ATM machine.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay, a hundred and twenty-five dollars, Amazon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that's the Muppet Show, on DVD, classic.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Twelve hundred dollars.  What's a Core Blaster Extreme?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is by far the best way to strengthen your core.  This machine, you sit on a stabilizer ball, you put your feet into the power stir-ups, you reach up and you grab onto the super rod, and you twist, and you twist, and you twist.  It strengthens your entire core.  Your back core, your arm core, the Marine Core actually uses it.  I think that's how they got a core.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I left a little present for Angela.  I think she's going to like it, because I found it outside of Vance Refrigeration all alone, and I told her in the note that the cat came to find her, that they were destined to be together.  I got game.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay, the green bar is what you spend every month on stuff you need, like a car and a house.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hm.  That is so cool how you have my name at the top.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The red bar is what you spend on non-essentials, like magazines, entertainment, things like that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This scary black bar is what you spend on things that no one ever, ever needs, like multiple magic sets, professional bass fishing equipment.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How do they do this so fast?  Is this power-point?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Man, Angela really had a hold on him. [Dwight playing the recorder in the background]  Angela.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, I'm going to set you and Jan up with a debt consolidator, you meet with this guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, we are going to leave Jan out of this.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: She has to know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We will find another way, we'll ask power-point.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, this is a presentation tool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're a presentation tool if you think I'm gonna tell Jan about this.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm done!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No you're not! Ok, just... you're not a tool. Look, we'll tell her that it's bad, but it could've been a lot worse but due to some fancy financial foot work I was able to cut it in half.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Jan is smart.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She poses.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, how's the hotel business?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stupid.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Have you checked Trip Advisor recently?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe you should.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe you should.  Whatever.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We wrote a good review.  Under comments, we wrote, the natural aroma of the beets drifts into the bedroom and makes you dream of simpler times.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The dawn goose walk will tug at your heartstrings.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Table making never seemed so possible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You will never want to leave your room.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The architecture reminds one of a quaint Tuscan beet farm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm glad you enjoyed your stay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We really did.  It was fun.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: So due to Michael's clever financial maneuvering, he finds himself tremendously in debt.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone] You're broke?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, that's, how did you get that from what Oscar's saying?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone] Michael, how did this happen?  Where did all your money go?  I don't, I don't get this.  I really don't.  I don't know how you could be so irresponsible.  I mean, this is, it is astounding to me, really.  I don't know what more to say.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone] Yeah, what?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael left.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone] Okay, where did he go?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone] Well, is he coming right back?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone] I'll be right there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What am I doing? I am blowing dodge. I'm getting out of town. Whatever you call it, I am running away from my responsibilities. And it feels good.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [to Andy] You may ask me out to dinner. Nothing fancy or foreign, no bars, no patios, no vegetables, and no seafood.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uhh-mmm [moaning]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did I ever tell you why I left Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [incoherent mumbling] No you didn't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I didn't think I had.  Well, it was all about Pam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmm-uh-mm [incoherent mumbling]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean she was with Roy, and, uh, I just couldn't take it.  I mean, I lost it Dwight.  I couldn't sleep, I couldn't concentrate on anything.  Even weird stuff, like food had no taste.  So my solution was to move away.  It was awful.  It was something that I wouldn't wish on my worst enemy, and that includes you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sobbing, reaches out to Jim after he walked away]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, I was thinking about dinner-- [Jim grabs her face and kisses her]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, dinner.  Let's see, maybe we should try the new Italian place, where the drive-in used to be.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim's just really passionate about Italian food.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep, I'm very passionate about Italian food.  In fact, um, I'm in love with Italian food.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Jan, he went running that way.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Alright. [throws her keys at Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] Runaway train, never come back.  Runaway and I'm never coming back.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not much, what's up with you?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, why are you sitting on a train?  Where are you going?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm out of answers Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I told you, no more answers.  This is who I am now.  A guy on a train with no answers.  I hope that can be enough for you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, come on.  Running away from your problems won't solve anything.  You know that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know that.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Your creditors can follow you anywhere with ease.  Your debt follows you around the world, electronically.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll stay off the grid.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Uh, Michael, come on, come on, you can deal with this.  It's not that bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah it is, it is.  I really messed up.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, when my life fell apart and they, and they screwed me in New York, and I felt like my whole world was collapsing around me, I didn't have anyone.  I mean, my whole family still won't even talk to me, on the advice of counsel, and my friends were just waiting for this to happen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's really nice of you to say.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael, no, what I want to say is you were there for me.  By my side.  Without even a thought.  That's just who you are.  I mean, no matter how badly I treat you, or what I'm going through, you just, you are there for me.  And that is a guy worth staying beside.  So, where's this train taking us?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think the engineer left.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [takes a ruler and shoves it between his desk and Jim's, knocking Jim's files on the floor]  Hello, this is Dwight Schrute calling from Dunder-Mifflin, and according to our records you appear to be low on office supplies.  Okay, sure, yeah I can take care of that right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't sell your implants please.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I'm keeping them. I know you like them. They're kind of uncomfortable though.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's nice though.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It's kind of painful and my nipples are over-sensitive now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It looks cute though.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I used to get offers in the mail for credit cards all the time.  They would say things like "don't pay for six months" or "you can transfer your account from another card"...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, [mumbling] I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you think I'll get any new ones?  I could... [pause, eventually looks up at Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you mean, "what"?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What... [mumbling]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Were you listening to what I was saying?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I was aware that you were speaking.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is the matter with you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is the matter with... me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm... discombobulated.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I need help.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, well, go find some.  Get outa here, please. [Dwight sighs and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay, you need to focus, Michael.  You need to stop spending money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I hate to ask you this, but are there any retirement funds you can borrow from?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, my CDs.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You have CDs?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay, good, okay.  What bank?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My CDs are in a portfolio, a rather large portfolio, um, called Case Logic

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [whispers] Case Logic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And, um the Case Logic portfolio is currently in the back seat of my car.  There is another smaller Case Logic portfolio clipped to my visor [Oscar vigorously shakes his head]  What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm asking about Certificates of Deposit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I've been putting money into CDs for years.  I bought music that I didn't even like.  No. [shakes head]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I just think that...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't go back to that.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I think you can.  I... what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know if I can do that.  I can't see myself spending the next six years digging myself out of that kind of hole.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: All right, well then maybe there's another way, you know?  I mean, we could just... we'll think of something else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We will?  I can't.  I don't have an idea in my head.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well... well, we will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: We just will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.  What?  Um...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I have some ideas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell me.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [laughs] I am not going to tell you yet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, please?  I won't tell anybody.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, yes, you will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I will.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gentlemen, a word.  Look, you guys are my closest friends in this office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right back at ya.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And as such, I come to you...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: State your business!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am dying of lovesickness and horny-sickness.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is impossible.  Unless you mean gonorrhea.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm talking about Angela, okay?  Did you hear what she was saying to Pam the other day?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, I did, 'cept I don't think she means it.  Angela is in a great deal of pain because of the death of her cat, and she's in a kind of a grieving process, and it makes her say things.  So... best to just lay off.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No can do.  I am itching all over with Angela-pox.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God, you do have gonorrhea.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey, Andy!  Maybe this is one of those situations where you just have to do her to get her out of your system.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stay out of this, you!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, fellas!  And... lady.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I still do not have your reimbursement check.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's not why I came over.  I mean it's a week late, but... I just came over to say hi.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [waves] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Angela, you like lacrosse?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Lacrosse, the sport?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Scranton U. Varsity's gonna scrimmage the J.V. squad.  Should be pretty interesting.  J.V. gets really amped.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, I guess it's a big opportunity for them.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You wanna go?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Because we could get some food...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Afterwards at the...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Andy, no. [Andy nods and starts backing away, Kevin giggles]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Still waiting on that check.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam!  You don't think he'll mind if we take the shampoo, do you? [holds up large bottle]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm.  Mmm-mmm. [shakes head 'no']

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Mose serves bacon] Thank you, Mose.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: [clears throat] Everybody poops.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, they do.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: There's no other... way to get rid of the food.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where's Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Gone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Where'd he go?

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: His day place.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The office.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: What office?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mose, Angela hasn't been around here much lately, has she?

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Angela?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela - she used to stay here sometimes?

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Angela [leaves].

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: [on trampoline] Cannonball! Lemon bomb!  Jim, Pam, watch!  Jim, Pam, watch!  Jim, Pam, watch!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, we're watching, Mose!

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Okay, go Yankees!  I'm a war hero!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're doin' great, buddy!

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Name's Mose, buddy!  Dwight, can I stop?  They're not even looking.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, go ahead and stop.  You guys, you should really be looking, he's working his ass off over here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry, did we or did we not pay for a show?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, go ahead, they're right.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Large spins!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [not watching Mose]  More spins.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Arr, dammit!  [throws saw at table he was working on]

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Helicopter!
